transportAdvice: Ghent's historic center is compact and very walkable, with most major attractions reachable on foot. The city also has an extensive tram and bus network covering tourist areas, and taxis are readily available for longer journeys.

weather.description: Cold and grey with frequent rain and occasional frost; pack warm, waterproof layers.
Still cold and damp with overcast skies, though daylight hours begin to lengthen slightly.
Temperatures begin to rise and early spring flowers appear, but showers remain common.
Mild and pleasant with occasional sunny spells, though rain can still interrupt outdoor plans.
Warm and increasingly sunny, making it one of the more enjoyable months to explore the city.
Warm summer weather with long evenings, though brief thunderstorms are possible.
The warmest month of the year with long daylight hours and a lively outdoor atmosphere.
Warm and similar to July, with occasional heavy showers breaking the heat.
Pleasantly mild early autumn with comfortable temperatures and fewer crowds.
Cooler and noticeably wetter as autumn sets in; a jacket and umbrella are essential.
Cold, damp, and often foggy; the city's cozy cafes and indoor attractions come into their own.
Cold and grey with a festive atmosphere in the city center; snow is possible but not common.
